topics.title: Python Programming for AI
learning_objectives: Write clean, efficient, and well-documented Python code
Use key libraries: NumPy, pandas, Matplotlib, and Scikit-learn effectively for data tasks
Master python programming for ai concepts and applications

resources.title: Python Fundamentals
resources.why: Covers variables, data types, functions, conditionals, loops, and error handling.

resources.title: Data Structures & Comprehensions
resources.why: Deep dive into lists, tuples, sets, and dictionaries, with a focus on powerful comprehension syntax.

project.title: Data Cleaning & Visualization Project
deliverables: Handles missing values and corrects data types using pandas
Script runs without errors and outputs 2-3 readable, labeled charts

topics.title: Linear Algebra for ML
learning_objectives: Manipulate matrices and vectors efficiently
Understand how linear algebra underpins ML algorithms
Master linear algebra for ml concepts and applications

resources.title: Vectors and Matrices
resources.why: Basic operations, shapes, transposes, and dot products.

resources.title: Matrix Decompositions
resources.why: Eigenvalues, eigenvectors, and singular value decomposition (SVD).

project.title: Linear Regression from Scratch
deliverables: Computes optimal weights using the Normal Equation
Predicts and plots regression line vs. data

topics.title: Statistics & Probability for ML
learning_objectives: Apply descriptive and inferential statistics to datasets
Model uncertainty using probability theory and distributions like Gaussian
Understand concepts like conditional probability and Bayes' theorem

resources.title: Descriptive Statistics
resources.why: Measures of central tendency (mean, median, mode) and dispersion (variance, standard deviation).

resources.title: Probability Theory
resources.why: Events, sample spaces, conditional probability, and Bayes' theorem.

project.title: Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA)
deliverables: Generates a report with key statistical findings and visualizations
Uses hypothesis testing to validate an assumption about the data

topics.title: Calculus for ML
learning_objectives: Understand how derivatives represent rates of change
Grasp the concept of gradients and their role in optimization
Follow the chain rule for backpropagation

resources.title: Derivatives and Rules
resources.why: Calculating derivatives of common functions and applying rules like the product and quotient rule.

resources.title: Gradients in Multiple Dimensions
resources.why: Partial derivatives, gradients of multivariable functions, and the Jacobian matrix.

project.title: Gradient Descent from Scratch
deliverables: Code correctly calculates gradients and updates parameters
Visualizes the optimization path on a contour plot

topics.title: Git & Version Control
learning_objectives: Manage code versions, branches, and merges effectively
Collaborate with others on a shared codebase using platforms like GitHub
Master git & version control concepts and applications

resources.title: Core Git Concepts
resources.why: The staging area, commits, and viewing history. Understanding `git add`, `git commit`, `git log`.

resources.title: Branching and Merging
resources.why: Creating feature branches, switching between them, and merging changes back into the main branch.

project.title: Collaborative Project Simulation
deliverables: Commit history on the feature branch is clear and descriptive

topics.title: Shell & Command-Line Basics
learning_objectives: Navigate and manage the filesystem from the command line
Use common shell commands and pipe outputs for powerful workflows
Master shell & command-line basics concepts and applications

resources.title: Filesystem Navigation
resources.why: Essential commands like `ls`, `cd`, `pwd`, `mkdir`, `rm`, `cp`, and `mv`.

resources.title: Text Processing Tools
resources.why: Using `cat`, `grep`, `sed`, and `awk` to search and manipulate text files.

project.title: Simple Log Analysis Script
deliverables: Script is executable and takes a filename as an argument
Correctly outputs the total count of lines containing 'ERROR'

topics.title: Machine Learning Foundations
learning_objectives: Build, train, and evaluate classical ML models using Scikit-learn
Understand the bias-variance tradeoff and how to prevent overfitting
Select appropriate algorithms for regression, classification, and clustering tasks

resources.title: Supervised Learning
resources.why: Linear/Logistic Regression, K-Nearest Neighbors (KNN), Support Vector Machines (SVMs), Decision Trees, and Random Forests.

resources.title: Unsupervised Learning
resources.why: Clustering algorithms (K-Means), dimensionality reduction (PCA), and anomaly detection.

project.title: End-to-End Classification Project
deliverables: Compares at least three different classification algorithms
Uses cross-validation to report a robust performance metric

topics.title: Deep Learning Fundamentals
learning_objectives: Design, train, and optimize deep learning models using a framework like TensorFlow or PyTorch
Understand the role of activation functions, optimizers, and loss functions
Implement common architectures like CNNs for images and RNNs for sequences

resources.title: Neural Networks & Backpropagation
resources.why: The structure of a neuron, layers, forward propagation, and the backpropagation algorithm.

resources.title: DL Frameworks (TensorFlow/PyTorch)
resources.why: Using high-level APIs like Keras or PyTorch to build and train models efficiently.

project.title: Image Classifier for Custom Dataset
deliverables: Achieves a reasonable accuracy (>85%) on a validation set
Demonstrates use of transfer learning from a pre-trained model like ResNet

topics.title: SQL and Data Management
learning_objectives: Write complex SQL queries to extract and aggregate data
Understand database design concepts like normalization
Master sql and data management concepts and applications

resources.title: SQL Querying
resources.why: SELECT statements, WHERE clauses, JOINs (INNER, LEFT), GROUP BY, and aggregations.

resources.title: Advanced SQL
resources.why: Subqueries, window functions, and Common Table Expressions (CTEs).

project.title: Data Analysis via SQL
deliverables: Queries correctly use JOINs and aggregate functions
Produces a short report summarizing the insights found in the data

topics.title: Data Engineering Foundations
learning_objectives: Understand ETL/ELT concepts and design data pipelines
Work with different data storage solutions (data warehouses, data lakes)
Master data engineering foundations concepts and applications

resources.title: ETL/ELT Pipelines
resources.why: The concepts of Extract, Transform, Load (ETL) and how to build data pipelines.

resources.title: Data Warehousing and Data Lakes
resources.why: Understanding the differences and use cases for structured data warehouses (e.g., BigQuery, Snowflake) and unstructured data lakes (e.g., S3).

project.title: Build a Mini ETL Pipeline
deliverables: Pipeline runs end-to-end without manual intervention
Data in the final database is clean and correctly formatted

topics.title: Cloud Computing Fundamentals
learning_objectives: Differentiate between IaaS, PaaS, and SaaS
Identify core cloud services for compute, storage, and networking
Master cloud computing fundamentals concepts and applications

resources.title: Core Cloud Concepts
resources.why: Virtualization, scalability, elasticity, and the pay-as-you-go model.

resources.title: Core Services: Compute & Storage
resources.why: Understanding virtual machines (EC2, Compute Engine), object storage (S3, GCS), and block storage.

project.title: Deploy a Web Server on a Cloud VM
deliverables: Web server is accessible from the public internet
Security groups/firewall rules are configured to only allow necessary traffic

topics.title: Working with APIs for ML
learning_objectives: Fetch data from third-party REST APIs
Build a simple API endpoint to serve a model prediction
Master working with apis for ml concepts and applications

resources.title: Consuming REST APIs
resources.why: HTTP methods (GET, POST), status codes, and JSON data handling using Python's `requests` library.

resources.title: Building APIs with Flask/FastAPI
resources.why: Creating simple web servers and API endpoints to expose functionality over HTTP.

project.title: Build a Model Serving API
deliverables: API endpoint successfully returns a JSON prediction when called

topics.title: Natural Language Processing
learning_objectives: Implement text preprocessing and vectorization techniques
Understand and apply transformer architectures (e.g., BERT, GPT)
Fine-tune pre-trained language models for specific tasks

resources.title: Text Processing & Embeddings
resources.why: Tokenization, stemming, lemmatization, and classic vectorization methods like TF-IDF and Word2Vec.

resources.title: Transformers and Attention
resources.why: The self-attention mechanism and the encoder-decoder architecture of the transformer model.

project.title: Fine-Tune a Sentiment Classifier
deliverables: Achieves high accuracy (>90%) on the test set
Code is well-structured and includes evaluation metrics

topics.title: Computer Vision
learning_objectives: Build and train advanced CNN-based models
Implement object detection and image segmentation techniques
Leverage transfer learning for vision tasks effectively

resources.title: Advanced CNN Architectures
resources.why: Studying influential architectures like ResNet, Inception, and EfficientNet.

resources.title: Object Detection
resources.why: Algorithms like YOLO and Faster R-CNN for identifying and localizing objects in an image.

project.title: Custom Object Detection
deliverables: Model correctly draws bounding boxes around the target object in test images
Includes a process for annotating a small custom dataset

topics.title: Reinforcement Learning (RL)
learning_objectives: Understand the core components of an RL problem (agent, environment, state, action, reward)
Implement foundational RL algorithms like Q-Learning
Master reinforcement learning (rl) concepts and applications

resources.title: RL Fundamentals
resources.why: Markov Decision Processes (MDPs), value functions, and policy functions.

resources.title: Q-Learning and Value-Based Methods
resources.why: Temporal difference learning and the Q-learning algorithm for discrete action spaces.

project.title: Train an Agent for a Gym Environment
deliverables: Agent consistently achieves the target score for the environment
Visualizes the agent's performance during and after training

topics.title: Time Series Analysis & Forecasting
learning_objectives: Decompose time series data into trend, seasonality, and residuals
Apply classical forecasting models like ARIMA
Use deep learning models like LSTMs for forecasting

resources.title: Time Series Decomposition
resources.why: Identifying and analyzing trend, seasonality, and cyclical components.

resources.title: Statistical Forecasting Models
resources.why: Models like ARIMA for forecasting based on statistical properties of the series.

project.title: Stock Price or Weather Forecasting
deliverables: Implements both an ARIMA and an LSTM model
Evaluates forecasts using metrics like Mean Absolute Error (MAE)

topics.title: Recommender Systems
learning_objectives: Understand and implement collaborative filtering
Build content-based recommendation models
Master recommender systems concepts and applications

resources.title: Collaborative Filtering
resources.why: User-based and item-based collaborative filtering techniques, including matrix factorization.

resources.title: Content-Based Filtering
resources.why: Recommending items based on their attributes and a user's profile.

project.title: Build a Movie Recommender
deliverables: System can generate a list of top N recommendations for a given user ID
Includes an evaluation of the recommender's performance

topics.title: Generative AI & LLMs
learning_objectives: Understand the architecture of modern LLMs like GPT
Learn techniques for prompting and fine-tuning LLMs
Grasp the basics of diffusion models for image generation

resources.title: LLM Architecture and Training
resources.why: The transformer decoder, pre-training objectives, and instruction tuning.

resources.title: Prompt Engineering and RAG
resources.why: Few-shot prompting, chain-of-thought, and Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) to enhance LLM performance.

project.title: Build a Q&A Bot with RAG
deliverables: Application can answer questions based on the content of the provided document
Uses a vector store for efficient document retrieval

topics.title: MLOps Principles & Lifecycle
learning_objectives: Map the end-to-end ML lifecycle from data to production
Understand the key pillars of MLOps: automation, reproducibility, and monitoring
Master mlops principles & lifecycle concepts and applications

resources.title: The ML Lifecycle
resources.why: The stages of an ML project: data collection, feature engineering, training, evaluation, deployment, and monitoring.

resources.title: Reproducibility in ML
resources.why: Techniques for ensuring reproducible results, including experiment tracking, data versioning, and environment management.

project.title: Experiment Tracking with MLflow
deliverables: MLflow UI shows multiple runs with logged metrics
Can load the best performing model artifact from MLflow

topics.title: Containerization with Docker
learning_objectives: Write a Dockerfile to containerize an ML application
Manage Docker containers and images
Master containerization with docker concepts and applications

resources.title: Docker Fundamentals
resources.why: Images, containers, and the difference between them. The Docker daemon and client.

resources.title: Writing a Dockerfile
resources.why: Instructions like `FROM`, `RUN`, `COPY`, and `CMD` to define a custom image.

project.title: Dockerize a Model Serving API
deliverables: Can send a request to the API running inside the container and get a prediction back

topics.title: CI/CD for Machine Learning
learning_objectives: Design a CI/CD pipeline for an ML project
Use GitHub Actions or Jenkins to automate ML workflows
Master ci/cd for machine learning concepts and applications

resources.title: Continuous Integration (CI)
resources.why: Automating code linting, unit tests, and data validation every time code is committed.

resources.title: Continuous Delivery/Deployment (CD)
resources.why: Automating the deployment of a model or an entire ML pipeline to a staging or production environment.

project.title: Build a CI/CD Pipeline with GitHub Actions
deliverables: Workflow triggers and runs successfully on GitHub
The new Docker image is visible in the container registry after a push

topics.title: Model Deployment & Serving
learning_objectives: Understand different model deployment patterns (e.g., online, batch)
Deploy a model to a cloud service for real-time inference
Master model deployment & serving concepts and applications

resources.title: Deployment Patterns
resources.why: Batch prediction vs. online (real-time) prediction. Deploying as a service vs. embedding in an application.

resources.title: Serverless Deployment
resources.why: Using cloud functions (AWS Lambda, Google Cloud Functions) to deploy models without managing servers.

project.title: Deploy a Model to a Cloud Platform
deliverables: Model is deployed and accessible via a public URL
The endpoint can successfully serve predictions

topics.title: Model Monitoring & Observability
learning_objectives: Understand the types of ML-specific monitoring (data drift, concept drift)
Implement logging and monitoring for a deployed model
Master model monitoring & observability concepts and applications

resources.title: Data and Concept Drift
resources.why: Understanding how changes in input data distribution (data drift) or the relationship between inputs and outputs (concept drift) can degrade model performance.

resources.title: Monitoring ML Metrics
resources.why: Tracking model accuracy, prediction latency, and data statistics over time.

project.title: Drift Detection Proof-of-Concept
deliverables: Script correctly identifies when the distribution of a feature has changed
Triggers an alert (e.g., a print statement) when drift is detected

topics.title: ML System Design & Architecture
learning_objectives: Apply system design principles to ML problems
Design architecture for common ML applications (e.g., recommender systems, search)
Master ml system design & architecture concepts and applications

resources.title: Scalability and Reliability
resources.why: Designing systems that can handle growing load and are resilient to failures.

resources.title: Data-Intensive Architectures
resources.why: Lambda and Kappa architectures for processing both batch and streaming data.

project.title: Write an ML System Design Document
deliverables: Document includes a clear architecture diagram
Considers trade-offs between different design choices (e.g., latency vs. cost)

topics.title: Data Engineering Fundamentals
learning_objectives: Design and implement ETL pipelines for ML data preparation
Work with SQL and NoSQL databases effectively
Handle large-scale data processing with distributed systems

resources.title: Data Engineering on Google Cloud
resources.why: Comprehensive cloud data engineering coverage

resources.title: Apache Spark Documentation
resources.why: Industry-standard distributed processing framework

topics.notes: Can start with local tools (SQLite, pandas). Cloud tools have free tiers.

topics.title: Computer Vision Fundamentals
learning_objectives: Implement CNNs for image classification and object detection
Apply transfer learning with pre-trained models
Build and evaluate computer vision systems

resources.title: CS231n: Convolutional Neural Networks
resources.why: Stanford course - gold standard for CV

resources.title: Fast.ai Practical Deep Learning Part 1
resources.why: Hands-on approach with state-of-the-art techniques

topics.notes: GPU required. Use free Colab or Kaggle kernels.

topics.title: NLP Fundamentals
learning_objectives: Implement text preprocessing and tokenization pipelines
Build text classification models using RNNs and word embeddings
Apply sequence-to-sequence models for NLP tasks

resources.title: CS224n: Natural Language Processing with Deep Learning
resources.why: Stanford NLP course with excellent lectures

resources.title: Speech and Language Processing
resources.why: Comprehensive NLP textbook

topics.notes: Start with CPU-based methods. GPU helpful but not required initially.

topics.title: Reinforcement Learning Basics
learning_objectives: Implement Q-learning and policy gradient algorithms
Train agents in simulated environments
Apply RL to real-world decision-making problems

resources.title: Reinforcement Learning: An Introduction
resources.why: Classic RL textbook by Sutton and Barto

resources.title: Deep Reinforcement Learning
resources.why: OpenAI practical guide to deep RL

topics.notes: Computationally intensive. Start with simple environments (CartPole, etc.)

topics.title: ML Model Interpretability
learning_objectives: Apply SHAP and LIME for model explanation
Implement feature importance analysis
Create interpretable model visualizations

resources.title: SHAP Documentation
resources.why: Industry-standard explainability library

resources.title: Interpretable Machine Learning
resources.why: Comprehensive guide to model interpretability

topics.notes: Most tools are free and open-source.

topics.title: Feature Engineering & Selection
learning_objectives: Design and engineer features from raw data
Apply dimensionality reduction techniques
Implement automated feature selection methods

resources.title: Feature Engineering for Machine Learning
resources.why: Comprehensive guide to feature engineering

resources.title: Feature Engineering on Kaggle
resources.why: Practical hands-on course

topics.notes: CPU-based work. No special compute requirements.

capstones.title: NLP Engineering Capstone
capstones.description: Build a production-grade NLP system demonstrating mastery of natural language processing techniques.

capstones.title: MLOps Engineering Capstone
capstones.description: Build a complete ML deployment pipeline demonstrating MLOps best practices.

capstones.title: ML Engineering Capstone
capstones.description: Build an end-to-end ML system from data collection to model deployment.

capstones.title: NLP Engineering Capstone Project 1
capstones.description: Advanced NLP project demonstrating specialized skills in natural language processing and understanding.

capstones.title: MLOps Engineering Capstone Project 1
capstones.description: Advanced MLOps project demonstrating specialized skills in production ML systems.

capstones.title: ML Engineering Capstone Project 1
capstones.description: Advanced ML project demonstrating specialized machine learning engineering skills.

capstones.title: NLP Engineering Capstone Project 2
capstones.description: Advanced NLP project demonstrating specialized skills in natural language processing and understanding.

capstones.title: MLOps Engineering Capstone Project 2
capstones.description: Advanced MLOps project demonstrating specialized skills in production ML systems.

capstones.title: ML Engineering Capstone Project 2
capstones.description: Advanced ML project demonstrating specialized machine learning engineering skills.
